metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the macos-def:inetlisteningservers_test is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the macos-def:inetlisteningservers_test.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.

criterion.comment: Test that the inetlisteningservers_object is supported with the program_name entity equal to some value.
Test that the inetlisteningservers_object is supported with the program_name entity not equal to some value.
Test that the inetlisteningservers_object is supported with the program_name entity matching some regular expression.

inetlisteningservers_test.comment: Test that the inetlisteningservers_object is supported with the program_name entity equal to some value.
Test that the inetlisteningservers_object is supported with the program_name entity not equal to some value.
Test that the inetlisteningservers_object is supported with the program_name entity matching some regular expression.

inetlisteningservers_object.comment: This object represents a inetlisteningservers_object with the program_name equal to 'sshd'.
This object represents a inetlisteningservers_object with the program_name not equal to 'sshd'.
This object represents a inetlisteningservers_object with the program_name matching the regular expression '^ss.d$'.

inetlisteningservers_state.comment: This inetlisteningservers_state represents an inetlisteningservers_item which has a local_address equal to '127.0.0.1', a local_port equal to '22', and a protocol equal to 'tcp'.
This inetlisteningservers_state represents inetlisteningservers_items which have a local_address not equal to '0.0.0.0', a local_port not equal to '0', and a protocol not equal to 'udp'.

This inetlisteningservers_state represents inetlisteningservers_items which have a local_address that matches the regular expression '^[0-9]+\.[0-9]+\.[0-9]+\.[0-9]+$', a local_port greater than or equal to '0', and a protocol that matches the regular expression '^t.p$'.
